passage_text: A group of fish is called a School of Fish. A group of geese is called a Gaggle of Geese. A group of sea gulls is called a Flock of Sea gulls. A bunch of cows and bulls is called a Herd of Cattle.

Well, I hear fish groups called a school more than a scholl. School is the correct answer no matter what the internet says. It's not always reliable. I, however, ALWAYS COME THROUGH! You'll just have to trust me.

A group of fishes is called a school of fish. In commercial fishing, a very large group of fish may look on the sonar like a shoal (an area where the sea floor is relatively … close to the surface, and will be called a shoal of fish. A group of marine mammals is often called a pod, as in a pod of porpoises.

It largely depends on what type of fish. Generally, a group of fish is called a school. However, sharks are fish as well and a group of sharks is called a gam, herd, pod, or shiver. Rays are also fish, but groups of rays are called a fever, draught, drift, scale, school, or shoal. Eels, another type of fish, in a group are called a swarm. A group of barracuda are called a battery.
school is a group of fish shoal is an area of shallow water in a larger body of water. Source(s): http://ca.encarta.msn.com/dictionary_186...
